User Input Offset Controls - Polar Angle
Camera :: 3rd Person Controls :: Radial Distance and Polar Angle (Z)

children.text: PERFORM 3D RAYCAST TO CHECK FOR CAMERA BEING BLOCKED.
THE BELOW BLOCK OF CODE IS TO USE POLAR ANGLE TO KEEP PLAYER IN CAMERA LOS
POLAR OPTIONS: Rotate up or down based on collisions.

Each object in line of sight needs to have their clearPoints calculated and resulting change in angle determined.  The worst case change in angle is logged for both the vBoxBottom and vBoxTop, the worst case of these 2 options chosen, along with an additional set of ray casts.

Check if the clearPoint is further away than the look point.  If it is, the anglediff is equal to the negative value of the sum of the current polar angle with the clearPointAngle calculated against the bottom edge (lower z) of the collider.  If it is not, the anglediff is equal to the calculated clearPointAngle - the current polar angle where the calculated angle is computed against the top edge (higher z).

Check if the clearPoint is further away than the look point.  If it is, the angle needs to be negative and computed against the bottom edge.  If it is not, the angle is positive and computed against the top edge.

Check if the clearPoint is further away than the look point.  If it is, the anglediff is equal to the negative value of the sum of the current polar angle with the clearPointAngle calculated against the bottom edge (lower z) of the collider.  If it is not, the anglediff is equal to the calculated clearPointAngle - the current polar angle where the calculated angle is computed against the top edge (higher z).

Check if the collider is a higher z than the vbox z.  If it is, the anglediff is equal to the calculated clearpoint angle using the closer edge - the current polar angle.  If it is not, the anglediff is equal to the calculated clearpoint angle using the further edge - the polar angle.

Check if the collider is a higher z than the vbox z.  If it is, the anglediff is equal to the calculated clearpoint angle using the closer edge - the current polar angle.  If it is not, the anglediff is equal to the calculated clearpoint angle using the further edge - the polar angle.
Check if worstCase position is clear of obstructions using raycast
Check if worstCase position is clear of obstructions using raycast and that the resulting polar angle is between the min and max
Optimal overall polar angle (lowest change from existing camera with clear view and in range of min and max)

actions.text: ENABLE BROWSER LOG BELOW AND VIEW IN GAME WITH F12 TO SEE THE JSON STRUCTURE RETURNED WHEN AN OBJECT IS HIT.
